title: Rangila Rasul
description: Rangila Rasul or Rangeela Rasool (meaning Promiscuous Prophet) was a book published during a period of confrontation between Arya Samaj and Muslims in Punjab during the 1920s. The controversial book concerned the marriages and sex life of Muhammad. Originally written in Urdu, it has been translated into Hindi. It remains banned in India, Pakistan and Bangladesh.
author: M.A. Chamupati
